data.flavor: A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.
data.text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to play events.
data.title: Prepaid VoicePAD
Wotan
data.text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [click][click].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 3[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 installed program.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner takes 1 brain damage.

fr.text:
[subroutine] Arrêtez le piratage, sauf si le Runner dépense [click][click].
[subroutine] Arrêtez le piratage, sauf si le Runner paye 3[credit].
[subroutine] Arrêtez le piratage, sauf si le Runner efface 1 programme installé.
[subroutine] Arrêtez le piratage, sauf si le Runner prend 1 dégât Neuro.
fr.title: Wotan

data.text:
Play only if the Runner installed a resource during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, add 1 installed resource to the top of the Runner's stack. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Hellion Alpha Test

fr.title: Test Hellion Alpha
fr.text:
Jouable uniquement si le Runner a installé une ressource lors de son dernier tour.
<trace>Traque 2</trace> Si la traque est réussie, mettez 1 ressource installée au sommet de la pile du Runner. Si la traque est ratée, prenez 1 pion Mauvaise Presse.

fr.flavor: "Ils appellent ça 'la retraite'. J'appelle ça 'une euthanasie'." - Ken "Express" Tenma
fr.title: Retraite de Clone
fr.text:
Lorsque vous finalisez Retraite de Clone, vous pouvez retirer 1 pion Mauvaise Presse.
Si le Runner vole Retraite de Clone, prenez 1 pion Mauvaise Presse.

data.flavor: "They call it 'retirement'. I call it 'euthanasia'." -Ken "Express" Tenma
data.text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Clone Retirement

data.text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.title: Swordsman

fr.text: Le Runner ne peut pas utiliser de programme IA pour neutraliser les routine de l'Épéiste. [subroutine] Effacez 1 programme IA. [subroutine] Infligez 1 dégât Réseau.
fr.title: Épéiste
fr.flavor: Écrire un programme capable de passer le test de Turing est facile. Le test Gibson-Akamatsu est un peu plus relevé, et les seules IA à le réussir, pour le moment, sont celles des androïdes. Il parait que même certains humains l'ont raté.

data.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.

data.title: Shipment from SanSan
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
data.flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.

fr.text:
Dépensez [click] comme coût additionnel pour jouer cette opération.
Mettez jusqu'à 2 pions Avancement sur une carte qui peut être avancée.
fr.title: Livraison de SanSan
fr.flavor: Il signa le reçu, les mains tremblantes d'impatience.

data.title: Muckraker
data.text:
When you rez Muckraker, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.

fr.title: Fouineur
fr.text:
Lorsque vous activez le Fouineur, prenez 1 pion Mauvaise Presse.
[subroutine] <trace>Traque 1</trace> Si la traque est réussie, donnez 1 Tag au Runner.
[subroutine] <trace>Traque 2</trace> Si la traque est réussie, donnez 1 Tag au Runner.
[subroutine] <trace>Traque 3</trace> Si la traque est réussie, donnez 1 Tag au Runner.
[subroutine] Arrêtez le piratage si le Runner est tagué.

data.title: The Cleaners
data.text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.
data.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."

fr.flavor: "J'utilise des bioroïdes parce que je peux effacer leur mémoire, ou tout simplement leur exploser la cervelle une fois le boulot terminé. Quand je dis 'pas de témoin', ça veut dire 'pas de témoin'."
fr.title: Les Nettoyeurs
fr.text: À chaque fois que vous faites des dégâts Hémo, faites 1 dégât Hémo supplémentaire.

data.text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Elizabeth Mills

fr.text: Lorsque vous activez Elizabeth Mills, retirez 1 pion Mauvaise Presse. [click], [trash]: Effacez 1 lieu. Prenez 1 pion Mauvaise Presse.
fr.title: Elizabeth Mills
fr.flavor: "Ça n'a rien de personnel. La réhabilitation urbaine est une nécessité du monde moderne. C'est toujours la maison de quelqu'un, la vôtre ne fait pas exception."

data.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."

data.text:
Install only in a remote server.
The Runner cannot initiate a run on this server.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on HQ, trash Off the Grid.
data.title: Off the Grid

fr.title: Hors-Réseau
fr.text:
À installer uniquement sur un serveur distant.
Le Runner ne peut pas lancer de piratage sur ce serveur.
Lorsque le Runner réussi un piratage sur le QG, effacez Hors-réseau.

data.text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5[credit] for each bad publicity taken.
data.title: Profiteering

fr.text: Lorsque vous finalisez Affairisme, prenez jusqu'à 3 pions Mauvaise Presse. Gagnez 5[credit] pour chaque pion Mauvaise Presse pris.
fr.title: Affairisme
fr.flavor: C'était étonnament facile de faire des créds… si vous ne vous souciiez pas de la facon dont vous les faisiez.

data.flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds…if you didn't care about how you made them.

data.text: Gain 15[credit].
data.title: Restructure

fr.flavor: Il y a pas mal de noms pour ceux qui travaillent dans le Département de la Direction. Mais, si tu aimes ton boulot, tu les appelles simplement "monsieur" ou "m'dame".
fr.title: Restructuration
fr.text: Gagnez 15[credit].

data.flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am".

data.text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
data.title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter
data.flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."

data.title: Deep Red
data.text: +3[mu] Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caïssa programs. Whenever you install a Caïssa program, you may trigger its [click] ability without spending [click]. Limit 1 console per player.

data.title: Knight
data.text: 2[credit]: Break subroutine on host ice. [click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Knight can be hosted only on ice that is not installed directly before or after the current piece of ice hosting Knight.
data.flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.

data.title: Running Interference
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[credit] as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.

data.flavor: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.
data.title: Expert Schedule Analyzer
data.text: [click]: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may reveal all cards in HQ.
When your turn ends, gain 1[credit] if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.
data.title: Grifter
data.flavor: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.

The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.
data.title: Torch
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

data.flavor: Looks can be deceiving.
data.text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.
data.title: Woman in the Red Dress

data.flavor:
"Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." -Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective.
"One of the best detectives on my PI list." -Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain.
data.title: Raymond Flint
data.text:
Whenever the Corp takes at least 1 bad publicity, access 1 card from HQ.
[trash]: Expose 1 card.

data.title: Isabel McGuire
data.text: [click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.
data.flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"

data.text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
data.title: Hudson 1.0
data.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
"I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"
data.title: Accelerated Diagnostics
data.text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.

data.title: Unorthodox Predictions
data.text: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen type cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.

data.flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
data.title: Sundew
data.text: The first time the Runner spends at least 1[click] on his or her turn, gain 2[credit] unless the Runner just initiated a run on this server.

data.flavor: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.
data.title: City Surveillance
data.text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1[credit].

When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.
data.title: Snoop

data.text: Ireress gains "[subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit]" for each bad publicity you have.
data.title: Ireress
data.flavor: Say it really fast.

data.title: Power Shutdown
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less. X is equal to or less than the highest install cost among all installed programs and pieces of hardware.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

data.title: Paper Wall
data.text:
If all subroutines on Paper Wall are broken during a single encounter, trash Paper Wall.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor: It folds under pressure.
"They're the only labor cheaper than clones."
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
data.title: Interns

data.text: [click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, look at the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of those cards at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed) and the Corp shuffles R&D.
data.title: Keyhole
data.flavor: The instructions claim that it sifts the most important data. 'Important', it has been found, is a highly relative term.
"They call me a terrorist to scare people. If they want to find terrorists, maybe they should start by looking in the mirror." -Reina Roja
data.title: Activist Support
data.text:
When the Corp turn begins, take 1 tag if you have no tags.
When your turn begins, give the Corp 1 bad publicity if he or she has no bad publicity.

As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Remove up to 2 tags and draw 3 cards.
data.title: Lawyer Up
data.flavor: Pros don't need to call their lawyer. Pros have their secretary rigged to do it for them if they ever go off-grid.
"Care to have a look?"
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Prevent all damage until the beginning of your next turn unless the Corp takes 2 bad publicity.
data.title: Leverage

data.flavor: The first credited icebreaker was nothing more than a unique script to bypass the security calls on a Gibson 3 Data Sentry. Garrote has over 20,000 times the data as that first breaker, but the idea remains the same: cut off the power source from the network, and then smash on through.
data.title: Garrote
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

data.title: LLDS Processor
data.text: Whenever you install an icebreaker, that icebreaker has +1 strength until the end of the turn.
data.flavor: LLDS Unlimited was born the day two designers answered the question "Why doesn't anyone make Diesel for computers?"
"One-shot icebreakers are popular among many of my protégés. They don't have the patience for the hunt." -The Professor
data.title: Sharpshooter
data.text: [trash]: Break any number of destroyer subroutines. 1[credit]: +2 strength.
[click]: Trash any number of cards from your grip. For each trashed card of which you have another copy installed, draw 1 card.
data.title: Capstone
data.flavor: "Once you have achieved perfection, what's next?" -The Professor

data.title: Starlight Crusade Funding
data.text: When your turn begins, lose [click]. Ignore any additional costs on each double event you play.
data.flavor: "I like to say 'Traditional values for a modern time.' War in space and life made by human hands, machines smart enough to ask if they have souls…Religion is as important and relevent now as at any time in human history. We must rise to meet the new challenges. And we must have faith."

data.text:
Place 3 power counters on Rex Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Rex Campaign, trash it and either remove 1 bad publicity or gain 5[credit].
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Rex Campaign.
data.title: Rex Campaign

data.text:
When you rez Fenris, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Fenris
data.flavor: As reported cases of brain damage in veterans rise, mind/machine interface devices are subject to increased public scrutiny. That certain programs can cause irreparable harm to users has gone from fringe theory to accepted truth.
The button didn't seem to do anything. So he pushed it again. And again. And again.
data.text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
1[credit]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.
data.title: Panic Button
Shock!
data.text:
If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Shock!, do 1 net damage, even if it is not installed.

data.flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
data.title: Tsurugi
data.text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

data.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
data.text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: TGTBT

data.flavor:
"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."
data.title: Sweeps Week
data.text: Gain 1[credit] for each card in the Runner's grip.

data.title: RSVP
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot spend any credits for the remainder of this run.
data.flavor: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal…strictly speaking.

data.text:
If Curtain Wall is the outermost piece of ice protecting a server, it has +4 strength.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Curtain Wall
data.flavor:
[subroutine] End the game.
Just kidding.

data.text:
<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
data.title: Punitive Counterstrike
data.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."

data.title: Veterans Program
data.text: When you score Veterans Program, you may remove up to 2 bad publicity.
data.flavor: It's easy to replace limbs. It's more difficult to replace memories.

That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
data.title: Quest Completed

data.text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
data.title: Hemorrhage
data.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.

data.text: Whenever a gray ops or black ops operation is trashed after resolving, you may give the Corp 1 bad publicity and take 1 tag. [trash]: Draw 1 card for each bad publicity the Corp has.
data.title: Tallie Perrault
data.flavor: Stick with your plan and you'll be fine. Stick with the plan.
"When you need someone who is a little more hands on, look me up." -Silhouette
data.title: Executive Wiretaps
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Reveal all cards in HQ.

data.title: Blackguard
data.text: +2[mu] Whenever you expose a card, the Corp must rez it by paying its rez cost, if able. Limit 1 console per player.
data.flavor: The power of the focused mind is a power beyond comprehension.

data.title: CyberSolutions Mem Chip
data.flavor: "CyberSolutions is a boring name for a company that makes pretty exciting products. Their memory chips have some pretty tricky stuff going on inside and I keep hearing good things about their M/MI implants. I even heard they were on the path to their own androids about a year ago. I wonder whatever happened with that?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

data.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
Use Alpha only on the outermost piece of ice protecting a server.
data.title: Alpha
data.flavor: The beginning…

data.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
Use Omega only on the innermost piece of ice protecting a server.
data.title: Omega
data.flavor: …and the end?

data.title: Blackmail
data.text:
Play only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
Make a run. The Corp cannot rez ice for the duration of this run.

data.flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Gain 5[credit] and draw 2 cards.
data.title: Blue Level Clearance
Strongbox
data.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.

Toshiyuki Sakai can be advanced.
If Toshiyuki Sakai is accessed while installed, you may swap him with an agenda or asset from HQ. The new agenda or asset is installed unrezzed, and keeps all advancement tokens on Toshiyuki Sakai. The Runner can choose not to access the new card.
data.title: Toshiyuki Sakai

data.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.title: Yagura
data.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime

data.title: Restoring Face
data.text: Trash one of your installed sysops, executives, or clones. If you do, remove up to 2 bad publicity.
data.flavor: He slowly pried open the lid, and the tantō glinted madly in the half-light. The executive motioned to the blade. Looks like the meeting was being cut short.

data.text:
If the Runner is tagged when you score Market Research, place 1 agenda counter on it.
Market Research is worth 1 additional agenda point while it has an agenda counter on it.
data.title: Market Research

data.flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
data.text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Wraparound
GRNDL: Power Unleashed
data.text: You start the game with 10[credit] and 1 bad publicity.
data.flavor: Geostrategic Research and Neothermal Development Laboratories
"I did warn you that leaks would have to be patched."
data.title: Vulcan Coverup
data.text:
When you score Vulcan Coverup, do 2 meat damage.
When the Runner steals Vulcan Coverup, take 1 bad publicity.

GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.
data.title: GRNDL Refinery
data.flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.

data.title: Subliminal Messaging
data.text:
Gain 1[credit]. Gain [click] if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn.
If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.

As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards in the server at no cost (even if they cannot normally be trashed).
data.title: Singularity

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
data.title: Queen's Gambit

data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using fracters.
data.title: Dyson Fractal Generator
data.flavor: The Dyson Fractal Generator is a useless lump of silicon; all it does is produce truly random results. What kind of madman slaps that in his rig? What's the use of a totally random number? -John Masanori

data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using killers.
data.title: Silencer
data.flavor: Take Moore's Law, iterate it over a century or two, and mix in quantum computing. You get to the point where you're developing the software on a hardware platform that you design at the same time. Tailor-made for each other. Exciting time to be alive! -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage

data.title: Savoir-faire
data.text:
You cannot use Savoir-faire more than once each turn.
2[credit]: Install a program from your grip, paying the install cost.
data.flavor: "Predictive algorithms that fetch you the program you need before you even know you need it. My second favorite lady." -Gabriel Santiago

There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
data.title: Fall Guy
data.text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].

data.title: Power Nap
data.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Gain 2[credit]. Gain an additional 1[credit] for each double event in your heap.
data.flavor: "When I said I could hack it in my sleep, did you think I was joking?" -Chaos Theory

data.title: Paintbrush
data.text: [click]: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate or barrier until the end of the next run this turn.
data.flavor: "Hand-made code is like hand-made art. You can see the brush strokes, which lets you see the artist. And then you can see everything in a new way." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Gain 9[credit].
data.title: Lucky Find
data.flavor: Data hunters always pay top dollar for old drives. The more useless the data, the higher the payout.
Once inside, the only way out is through your own mind.
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2 until the beginning of the Corp's next turn.
data.title: Gyri Labyrinth

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Name a card other than Reclamation Order. Reveal any number of copies of the named card from Archives and add them to HQ.
data.title: Reclamation Order
Broadcast Square
data.text: Whenever you are about to take at least 1 bad publicity, <trace>trace 3</trace> if successful, avoid taking the bad publicity.
data.flavor: Tourists have flocked to Broadcast Square in even greater numbers ever since the notorious Ho-meh's crime spree ended there in a hail of flechettes. Well, that's how it happened in the sensie.

data.title: Corporate Shuffle
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. Draw 5 cards.
data.flavor: The only thing worse than being fired and replaced by a younger, cheaper worker? Being replaced by an android.

data.title: Caprice Nisei
data.text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, end the run.
data.flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.

data.text:
When you rez Shinobi, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, do 3 net damage and end the run.
data.title: Shinobi
Marker
data.text: [subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.
data.flavor: "It doesn't do anything in and of itself. It just marks you as an intruder and makes the next ice do all the work." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

data.title: Hive
data.text:
Hive loses an "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: "Now, let's talk about how little you remember of the events of June sixth through sixteenth."
data.title: Witness Tampering
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Remove up to 2 bad publicity.

The advancement requirement of NAPD Contract is increased by 1 for each bad publicity the Corp has.
As an additional cost to steal NAPD Contract, the Runner must pay 4[credit].
data.title: NAPD Contract
Quandary
data.text: [subroutine] End the run.
data.flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.

data.text: Each player needs 1 fewer agenda point to win the game.
data.title: Harmony Medtech: Biomedical Pioneer

fr.title: Centre Médical Harmony Medtech : Précuseur Biomedical
fr.flavor: Nous faisons évoluer le Meilleur de Vous-Même.
fr.text: Chaque joueur a besoin de 1 point de projet de moins pour gagner la partie.

data.flavor: Evolving a Better You.

data.text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, gain 1[credit].
data.title: Nisei Division: The Next Generation

fr.text: Lorsque le Runner et vous révélez des crédits dépensés secrètement, gagnez 1[credit].
fr.flavor: Parfaire l'Imperfection.
fr.title: Division Nisei : La Prochaine Génération

data.flavor: Perfecting the Imperfect.

fr.text: Au début de votre tour, vous pouvez placer 1 pion Avancement sure un carte si le Runner n'a pas réussi de piratage durant son dernier tour.
fr.title: Institut Tennin : Les Secrets Cachés

data.title: Tennin Institute: The Secrets Within
data.text: When your turn begins, you may place 1 advancement token on a card if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.

fr.text: Lorsque vous finalisez la Maison des Lames, placez 3 pions projet dessus. Pion projet hébergé : Infligez 1 dégât Réseau. N'utilisez cette capacité que pendant un piratage et une seule fois par piratage.
fr.title: Maison Des Lames

data.title: House of Knives
data.text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.

data.flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."

fr.text: La valeur d'avancement de chaque Percée Médicale est réduite de 1. Cette capacité est active même si la Percée Médicale est dans la zone de score du Runner.
fr.flavor: "Vous ne sentirez pas cette piqûre. Ni quoi que ce soit d'autre, d'ailleurs"
fr.title: Percée Médicale

data.title: Medical Breakthrough
data.text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.

fr.text:
Lorsque vous finalisez l'Enchevêtrement Philotique, infligez au Runner 1 dégât Réseau pour chaque projet dans sa zone de score.
Maximum 1 Enchevêtrement Philotique par deck.
fr.title: Enchevêtrement Philotique

data.title: Philotic Entanglement
data.text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.

fr.title: La Perfection Future
fr.text: Lorsque le Runner accède à La Perfection Future, le Runner et vous dépensez secrètement 0[credit], 1[credit], ou 2[credit]. Révélez les crédits dépensés. Si le Runner et vous avez dépensé un nombre de crédits différent, prévenez le vol de La Perfection Future. Ignorez cet effet si le Runner accède à La Perfection Future alors qu'elle est installée.

data.title: The Future Perfect
data.text: When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.

fr.title: Président Hiro
fr.text:
La taille maximale de la main du Runner est réduite de 2.
Si le président Hiro est effacé lorsqu'on y accède, ajoutez-le à la zone de score du Runner comme un projet valant 2 points de projet.

data.text:
The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
data.title: Chairman Hiro
Mental Health Clinic
data.text:
Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.
data.flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.

fr.flavor: Les murs blanchis à la chaux s'évannouirent tandis qu'un magnifique jardin zen apparaissait. Ce n'était qu'une illusion, mais une illusion réconfortante.
fr.title: Clinique Psychiatrique
fr.text:
Gagnez 1[credit] au début de votre tour.
La taille maximale de la main du Runner est augmentée de 1.

Si le Champ Psychique est installé et que le Runner l'expose ou y accède, le Runner et vous dépensez secrètement 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Révélez les crédits dépensés. Si le Runner et vous avez dépensez un nombre de crédits différent, infligez au Runner un nombre de dégâts Réseau égal au nombre de cartes dans sa main.
fr.title: Champ Psychique

data.text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
data.title: Psychic Field

data.text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū, you may pay X[credit]. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyū to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū from R&D.
data.title: Shi.Kyū

fr.title: Shi.Kyū
fr.text: Lorsque le Runner accède à Shi.Kyū, vous pouvez payer X[credit]. Le Runner choisit entre subir X dégâts Réseau ou ajouter Shi.Kyū à sa zone de score comme un projet valant -1 point de projet. Ignorez cette capacité si le Runner accède à Shi.Kyū depuis R&D.

data.flavor: The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.

fr.text: [click]: Échangez les positions de 2 glaces installées.
fr.title: Série Tenma
fr.flavor: Les clones Tenma sont aujourd'hui la troisième série la plus lucrative de Jinteki, suite à l'expansion urbaine rapide ayant suivi la guerre. Leur temps de réaction, leur fiabilité et leur ponctualité font deux un choix de prédilection pour l'expédition et les services de transport.

data.title: Tenma Line
data.text: [click]: Swap 2 pieces of installed ice.

Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, he or she chooses to suffer 1 brain damage or take 1 tag.
data.title: Cerebral Cast

fr.title: Entrave Cérébrale
fr.text:
Jouable uniquement si le Runner a réussi un piratage lors de son dernier tour.
Le Runner et vous dépensez secrètement 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Révélez les crédits dépensés. Si le Runner et vous avez dépensé un nombre de crédits différent, il choisit entre subir 1 dégât Neuro ou prendre 1 tag.

data.text: Gain 8[credit]. The Runner gains 3[credit].
data.title: Medical Research Fundraiser

fr.text: Gagnez 8[credit]. Le Runner gagne 3[credit].
fr.flavor: "Ensemble, nous avons éradiqué toutes les maladies naturelles de la surface de la planète. Le nouveau spectre de la maladie synthétique - du bioterrorisme - exige que nous continuions nos efforts."
fr.title: Gala de Charité Médicale

data.flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease-of bioterrorism-demands that we continue our efforts."

fr.text:
Dépensez [click] comme coût additionnel pour jouer cette opération.
Installez un Avoir, un Projet ou une Extension depuis le QG dans un nouveau serveur distant. Placez 3 pions Avancement sur cette carte. Vous ne pouvez pas finaliser ou activer cette carte avant votre prochain tour.
fr.title: Mushin No Shin

data.title: Mushin No Shin
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install an asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in a new remote server. Place 3 advancement tokens on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.

[subroutine] The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.
data.title: Inazuma

fr.title: Inazuma
fr.flavor: Piégé dans sa propre réalité, un runner paralysé ne peut même pas débrancher.
fr.text:
[subroutine] Le Runner ne peut neutraliser aucune routine de la prochaine glace qu'il rencontre durant ce piratage.
[subroutine] Le Runner ne peut pas débrancher avant d'avoir rencontré la prochaine glace durant ce piratage.

data.flavor: Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.

fr.text: Lorsque le Runner le rencontre, Komainu gagne jusqu'à la fin du piratage "[subroutine] Infligez 1 dégât Réseau." pour chaque carte dans la main du Runner.
fr.title: Komainu

data.title: Komainu
data.text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.

fr.flavor: ouaf ouaf !
fr.title: Chiot
fr.text:
[subroutine] Infligez un dégât Réseau sauf si le Runner paye 1[credit].
[subroutine] Infligez un dégât Réseau sauf si le Runner paye 1[credit].

data.flavor: Yip Yip!
data.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
data.title: Pup

data.flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.

fr.title: Shiro
fr.flavor: Lorsque vous êtes enfermé dans la forteresse de votre propre esprit, prenez garde aux portes que vous ouvrez.
fr.text:
[subroutine] Regardez les 3 premières cartes de R&D et replacez-les dans l'ordre de votre choix.
[subroutine] Le Runner accède à la première carte de R&D sauf si la Corpo paye 1[credit].

data.title: Shiro
data.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] The Runner accesses the top card of R&D unless the Corp pays 1[credit].

[subroutine] If not already running on Archives, the Runner is now running on Archives instead of passing Susanoo-no-Mikoto. The Runner cannot jack out until after he or she encounters a piece of ice.
data.title: Susanoo-no-Mikoto

fr.text: [subroutine] Si ce piratage n'est pas mené sur les Archives, le Runner mène désormais un piratage sur les Archives au lieu de passer Susanoo-No-Mikoto. Le Runner ne peut débrancher qu'après avoir rencontré une glace.
fr.title: Susanoo-No-Mikoto
fr.flavor: Certaines zones du cyberespace sont dominées par une entité digitale unique. Les Runners les nomment 'dieux', et seul un miracle peut sauver les fous osant s'aventurer sur leur domaine.

data.flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.

data.text: The first time an advancement token is a placed on a card in this server each turn, gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: NeoTokyo Grid

fr.text: À chaque tour, la première fois qu'un pion avancement est placé sur une carte dans ce serveur, gagnez 1[credit]. Maximum 1 région par serveur.
fr.title: Grille de NéoTokyo
fr.flavor: Il est difficile d'aller au Japon sans se retrouver dans les méandres de NéoTokyo.

data.flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.

fr.title: Tori Hanzō
fr.flavor: Connue sous le surnom de La Femme Rouge, Hanzō est réputée pour ses méthodes impitoyable de protection des serveurs.
fr.text: La première fois que vous devriez infliger un ou plusieurs dégâts Réseau lors de chaque piratage sur ce serveur, vous pouvez à la place payer 2[credit] pour infliger 1 dégât Neuro.

data.flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.
data.text: The first time you would do any amount of net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2[credit] to do 1 brain damage.
data.title: Tori Hanzō

data.text:
Plan B can be advanced.
If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.
data.title: Plan B

fr.title: Plan B
fr.text:
Plan B peut être avancé.
Si le Runner accède au Plan B, Vous pouvez révéler et finaliser un projet du QG avec une valeur d'avancement inférieure ou égale au nombre de pions Avancement sur le Plan B.

data.text:
Guard cannot be bypassed.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Guard

fr.title: Garde
fr.flavor: À l'extrémité de son champ de vision, un éclair de lumière. Il ressentit un bruit sourd tandis que son emprise sur le cyberespace faiblissait. Spider n'aimait pas ça. Il aurait dû traverser la couche de glace externe en se connectant depuis le serveur interne. Un autre bruit sourd et son ossaturefût secouée par la résonnance de l'onde de choc. Il porta désespérément la main vers son shuriken…
fr.text:
Le Garde ne peut pas être ignoré.
[subroutine] Arrêtez le piratage.

data.flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…

fr.text: [subroutine] Arrêtez le piratage.
fr.title: Arc-en-ciel
fr.flavor: Le rapport annuel de la FCSN met régulièrement en avant les glaces ayant le plus d'impact par rapport à leur taille et leur coût d'entretien. Les critiques de la FCSN considèrent que le taux de répulsion est le premier critère pour évaluer une glace.

data.flavor: The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.
data.text: [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Rainbow

data.text: Gain 1[credit] for each remote server with a card installed in it.
data.title: Diversified Portfolio

fr.text: Gagnez 1[credit] pour chaque serveur distant contenant une carte installée.
fr.flavor: YuCafé a fait montre d'une croissance époustouflante, y compris dans les marchés les plus reculés.
fr.title: Portefeuille Diversifié

data.flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.
The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.

fr.text: Cherchez un projet dans votre R&D, révélez-le et ajoutez le à votre QG. Mélangez votre R&D.
fr.flavor: Moins les employés regardaient l'horloge de l'apocalypse, plus elle les obsédait. Un coup d'œil rapide ne faisait que confirmer ce qu'ils savaient déjà : ils manquaient de temps
fr.title: Recherche Accélérée

data.title: Fast Track
data.text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

data.title: Iain Stirling: Retired Spook
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 2[credit] if the Corp has more scored agenda points than you.
data.flavor: "Truth is a fickle mistress."

fr.flavor: "La vérité est une maîtresse capricieuse."
fr.title: Iain Stirling : Espion à la Retraite
fr.text: Au début de votre tour, gagnez 2[credit] si la Corpo a plus de points de projet dans sa zone de score que vous.

data.title: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone
data.text: The first time you play a run event each turn, gain 1[credit].
data.flavor: "Try to keep up."

fr.text: La première fois que vous jouez un évènement piratage à chaque tour, gagnez 1[credit].
fr.flavor: "Essaye de suivre le rythme."
fr.title: Ken "Express" Tenma : Clone Disparu

data.flavor: "Don't waste my time."

fr.flavor: "Ne me faites pas perdre mon temps."
fr.title: Silhouette : Agent Furtif
fr.text: À chaque tour, la première fois que vous réussissez un piratage sur le QG, vous pouvez exposer une carte.

data.title: Silhouette: Stealth Operative
data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may expose 1 card.

data.title: Calling in Favors
data.text: Gain 1[credit] for each installed connection resource.
data.flavor: A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.

fr.title: Renvoi d'Ascenseur
fr.flavor: La réussite d'un crime dépend toujours du membre le plus faible. Heureusement, Miss Jones est très ponctuelle.
fr.text: Gagnez 1[credit] pour chaque ressource relation installée.

data.text:
Play only as your first click.
Make a run and gain [click].
data.title: Early Bird

fr.text:
Jouable uniquement à votre premier click.
Lancez un piratage et gagnez [click].
fr.title: Lève-Tôt
fr.flavor: Leur cerveau étant conçu pour le traitement en parallèle, les Tenma excellent dans l'art de faire plusieurs choses à la fois.

data.flavor: Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.
The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.

fr.text: Regardez les 4 premières cartes de votre pile et ajoutez 1 de ces cartes à votre main. Mélangez votre pile.
fr.title: Livraison "Express"
fr.flavor: Le clone fut surpris de voir l'homme à la veste rouge. C'était comme se regarder dans un mirroir, sauf que le mirroir lui renvoyait une image… cool. Confiante. Unique.

data.title: Express Delivery
data.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

data.flavor: Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.

fr.text: Lancez un piratage sur le QG. Ignorez les deux premières glaces que vous rencontrez lors de ce piratage. S'il est réussi, vous ne pouvez accéder à aucune carte.
fr.title: Feinte
fr.flavor: Stirling entra dans le serveur, s'approchant d'une glace qui se mit à grogner. Il était désarmé… du moins en apparence

data.title: Feint
data.text: Make a run on HQ. Bypass the first 2 pieces of ice encountered during this run. If successful, you cannot access any cards.

data.flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette

fr.flavor: "Je travaille sur références uniquement, et je demande une avance. Le tarif est raisonnable si vous accordez de l'importance aux résultats." - Silhouette
fr.title: Collecte d'Informations
fr.text: Lancez un piratage sur le QG. S'il est réussi, accédez à 2 cartes supplémentaires du QG.

data.title: Legwork
data.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.

fr.title: Attaque Planifiée
fr.text: Dépensez [click] comme coût additionnel pour jouer cet évéement. Cherchez un événement piratage dans votre pile et jouez cet événement (en payant son coût), enignorant les coûts additionnels. Mélangez votre pile.

data.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Planned Assault
Logos
data.text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.

fr.text: +1[mu] Votre taille de main est augmenté de 1. À chaque fois que la Corpo finalise un projet, vous pouvez chercher une carte dans votre pile et l'ajouter à votre main. Mélangez votre pile. Maximum 1 console en jeu.
fr.title: Logos

data.title: Public Terminal
data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to play run events.
data.flavor: Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.

fr.text: 1[recurring-credit] N'utilisez ce crédit que pour jouer les événements piratage.
fr.flavor: Express adorait les bibliothèques. Les consoles y étaient de mauvaise qualité, mais la sécurité encore pire. Il téléchargea son code à distance et commença à cloner le disque dur. Dans quelques minutes, un nouveau zombie émergerait à la surface du cyberespace.
fr.title: Terminal Public

fr.text: N'utilez le Smith & Wesson 35 de Contrebande que si vous avez réussi un piratage sur le QG ce tour-ci. [click], [click]: Effacez un bioroïde, un clone, uncadre or un sysop activé dans un serveur sans payer son coût d'effacement.
fr.title: Smith & Wesson 35 de Contrebande

data.title: Unregistered S&W '35
data.text: Use Unregistered S&W '35 only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn. [click], [click]: Trash 1 rezzed bioroid, clone, executive, or sysop in a server without paying its trash cost.

data.title: Window
data.text: [click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of your stack.
data.flavor: The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.

fr.text: [click]: Piochez 1 carte du dessous de votre pile.
fr.flavor: L'herbe semblait plus verte de l'autre coté de la faille. Comme toujours, et il y avait toujours une autre faille.
fr.title: Fenêtre

data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength. Alias cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
data.title: Alias

fr.text: 1[credit]: Neutralisez une routine sentinelle. 2[credit]: Force +3. Alias ne peut pas être utilisé sur une glace protégeant un serveur distant.
fr.title: Alias
fr.flavor: Il est facile de modifier son apparence dans le cyberespace, mais un rendu de bonne qualité n'est pas aisé à obtenir.

data.flavor: Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.

fr.title: Brèche
fr.text: 2[credit]: Neutralisez jusqu'à 3 routines barrière. 2[credit]: Force +4. Brèche ne peut pas être utilisé sur une glace protégeant un serveur distant.

data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +4 strength. Breach cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
data.title: Breach

data.flavor: The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.

fr.title: Punaise
fr.flavor: L'équivalent digital d'une mouche sur un mur.
fr.text:
Jouable uniquement si vous avez réussi un piratage sur le QG ce tour-ci.
À chaque fois que la Corpo pioche une carte, vous pouvez payer 2[credit] pour révéler cette carte.

data.title: Bug
data.text:
Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Whenever the Corp draws a card, you may pay 2[credit] to reveal that card.

data.title: Gingerbread
data.text: 1[credit]: Break tracer subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
data.flavor: Catch me if you can!

fr.text: 1[credit]: Neutralisez une routine traqueur. 2[credit]: Force +3.
fr.title: Bonhomme de Pain d'Épices
fr.flavor: Attrape-moi si tu peux !

fr.text: [trash]: Neutralisez toutes les routines d'une glace sauf 1.
fr.title: Grappin
fr.flavor: Si la rapidité est essentielle, l'approche indirecte d'une glace est en général la meilleure méthode.

data.flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.
data.text: [trash]: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.
data.title: Grappling Hook

data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. Passport cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
data.title: Passport

fr.text: 1[credit]: Neutralisez une routine verrou. 2[credit]: Force +2. Passeport ne peut pas être utilisé sur une glace protégeant un serveur distant.
fr.title: Passeport
fr.flavor: Rien n'est suffisamment protégé si vous avez la bonne documentation.

data.flavor: Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.

fr.title: Pari Risqué
fr.text: Dépensez secrètement n'importe quel nombre de crédits. La Corpo doit deviner si vous avez dépensé un nombre pair ou impair de crédits. Révélez les crédits dépensés. Si la Corpo s'est trompée, gagnez le double des crédits dépensés.

data.title: Push Your Luck
data.text: Secretly spend any number of credits. The Corp guesses if you spent an even or odd amount. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, gain credits equal to twice the amount spent.

data.title: Security Testing
data.text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
data.flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.

fr.text: Au début de votre tour, choisissez un serveur. La première fois que vous réussissez un piratage sur ce serveur ce tour-ci, au lieu d'accéder à des cartes, gagnez 2[credit].
fr.title: Test de Sécurité
fr.flavor: Elle a été aussi efficace que Mr. Li le disait. La machine source a été infectée en moins de 24 heures. Si un agent indépendant pouvait faire ça, le serveur n'était manifestement pas prêt à endurer les assauts des légions des runners corporatistes de Gagarin

data.title: Theophilius Bagbiter
data.text:
When you install Theophilius Bagbiter, lose all credits in your credit pool.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
data.flavor: "Why is a raven like a typing desk?"

fr.text:
Lorsque vous installez Théophilius Bagbiter, perdez tous les crédits de votre réserve.
Votre taille maximale de main est égale au nombre de crédits dans votre réserve.
fr.flavor: "Quelle différence y a-t-il entre un pigeon?"
fr.title: Théophilius Bagbiter

data.flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?

fr.flavor:
Elle remonta sur son hopper. "Je fais partie de ta famille, maintenant, alors ne me déçois pas, dǒng ma ?"
Il retira son e-clope de sa bouche et hocha de la tête. Dans quoi s'était-il embarqué ?
fr.title: Contact Tri-Maf
fr.text:
Vous ne pouvez utiliser Contact Tri-Maf qu'une fois par tour.
[click]: Gagnez 2[credit].
Lorsque Contact Tri-Maf est éffacé, subissez 3 dégâts Hémos.

data.title: Tri-maf Contact
data.text:
You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.

fr.title: Installation Massive
fr.flavor: "Bienvenue dans l'assistant d'installation massive ! Cet assistant va vous guider tout au long de l'installation d'un tas de programmes dans votre station probablement inadéquate. Lorsque vous êtes prêt, dites - oups, trop tard, ça a commencé !"
fr.text: Installez jusqu'à 3 programmes de votre mai (en payant les coûts d'installation).

data.flavor: "Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say-oops, too late, here we go!"
data.text: Install up to 3 programs from your grip (paying the install costs).
data.title: Mass Install

data.text:
+1[mu]
Trash Q-Coherence Chip when an installed program is trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>
data.title: Q-Coherence Chip

fr.text:
+1[mu]
Effacez la Puce de Q-Cohérence lorsqu'un programme est effacé.
fr.title: Puce de Q-Cohérence
fr.flavor: L'un des problèmes principaux du calcul quantique est d'isoler le système des facteurs externes pour éviter la décohérence. La puce de Q-Cohérence est l'une des solutions, imparfaite, à ce problème.

data.flavor: One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.

fr.text: Lors de son installation, placez un pion Pouvoir sur Maître-esprit pour chaque UM inutilisée. Pion Pouvoir hébergé : Neutralisez une routine de glace. 1[credit]: Force +1.
fr.title: Maître-Esprit

data.title: Overmind
data.text: Place 1 power counter on Overmind when it is installed for each unused MU. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

fr.flavor: "Le meilleur endroit pour se cacher est au vu et au su de tout le monde, tu ne crois pas ?"
fr.title: Oracle May
fr.text:
Vous ne pouvez utiliser Oracle May qu'une fois par tour.
[click]: Énoncez un type de carte. Révélez la première carte de votre deck. Si elle est du type énoncé, piochez-la et gagnez 2[credit]. Sinon, effacez-la.

data.flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"
data.text:
You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn.
[click]: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2[credit]. Otherwise, trash it.
data.title: Oracle May

data.flavor: You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.

fr.text: Le coût des opérations et des événements est augmenté de 1.
fr.flavor: On peut trouver Donut dans le parc les jeudis après-midi, en train de jouer au backgammon. Pour attirer son attention, un seul moyen : une tasse de café et un donut. Vous pouvez alors vous asseoir à sa table, et vous pouvez discuter affaires et tarifs jusqu'à ce qu'il gagne.
fr.title: Donut Taganes

data.title: Donut Taganes
data.text: The play cost of operations and events is increased by 1.

data.title: Domestic Sleepers
data.text:
[click],[click],[click]: Place 1 agenda counter on Domestic Sleepers.
Domestic Sleepers is worth 1 agenda point while it has at least 1 agenda counter on it.
NEXT Silver gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.
data.title: NEXT Silver
data.flavor: The networking capabilities of the NEXT suite of ice are unparalleled.
"Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
data.text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Lotus Field
Mutate
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash a rezzed piece of ice.
Reveal cards from the top of R&D until you reveal a piece of ice. Install and rez that ice in the same position as the ice that was trashed, ignoring all costs. Shuffle R&D.

data.flavor: Only the News You Need.
data.title: Near-Earth Hub: Broadcast Center
data.text: The first time you create a server each turn, draw 1 card.

data.title: Primary Transmission Dish
data.text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during traces.
data.flavor: Works better than a PAD hooked up to a tinfoil umbrella and coffee can.
Halfway upstalk, Midway is a destination unto itself with its microgravity hotels and fine dining options.
data.text: The Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine during a run on this server. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Midway Station Grid

data.text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to advance, install, and rez cards.
data.title: The Root
data.flavor: They said it couldn't be built. That it was a fantasy. That Jack Weyland was a fool, and he had bought the fools in Washington too. But year after year the buckyweave grew, and 'they' stopped talking.

data.text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 piece of hardware.
data.title: Taurus
data.flavor: Taurus promised strength, but gave only rage.

On the first day She breathed data into the void, and it hung suspended like jewelled stars. On the second day She spoke order into the data, and it flowed from rivulets into streams and from streams into mighty rivers. On the third day She gave independence to the order, and it ebbed and flowed according to its own accord. -The Cant of Helios
data.title: Mother Goddess
data.text:
Mother Goddess gains the subtypes of all other rezzed ice.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: He who bears the shield of honor.
data.title: Galahad
data.text: When the Runner encounters Galahad, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Galahad gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] End the run.

data.title: Bad Times
data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner's memory limit is reduced by 2 until the end of the turn.
data.flavor: Known as malware 0-394-41525-6 to sysops, runners just refer to it as "bad times."

data.title: Cyber Threat
data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose a server. The Corp can rez a piece of ice protecting this server. If he or she does not, make a run on that server, during which the Corp cannot rez ice.

data.title: Lamprey
data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[credit].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.

data.flavor: His eyes were beginning to blur, as he duplicated the credentials for what seemed like the fiftieth time. Perhaps a genetic refit would have been easier.
data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Remove all tags.
data.title: Paper Tripping

data.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever a trace is initiated.
data.title: Power Tap
data.flavor: "Public network kiosks, vending machines-there's all sorts of poorly-secured power sources in the city. Tap in to one of these and you've got plenty of juice when you need it. A little advance warning when the power grid starts misbehaving, too." -Gabriel Santiago

data.text: Whenever you encounter a piece of ice that was just rezzed, lose all credits in your credit pool. Gain credits equal to the rez cost of that ice.
data.title: Nasir Meidan: Cyber Explorer

data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. If the Corp rezzes that piece of ice this turn, gain credits equal to its rez cost.
data.title: Social Engineering

data.text: Leprechaun can host up to 2 programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit.
data.title: Leprechaun
data.flavor: "I once saw someone running a seven-tier nested daemon tree. Not for any good reason, just to see if he could. Well, of course the root daemon crashed and he lost everything. I wonder what he's up to now?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may install Eden Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: The Corp draws 2 cards.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Eden Shard
The Foundry: Refining the Process
data.text: The first time you rez a piece of ice each turn, you may search R&D for another copy of that ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

data.title: Enhanced Login Protocol
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run not made through a card ability on his or her turn, the Runner must spend [click].

data.title: Heinlein Grid
data.text: If the Runner loses or spends a click during a run on this server, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool. Limit 1 region per server.
data.flavor: "There are many advantages to having facilities on the moon. Less traffic, for example." -Director Hass
"Binary computing  is obsolete. I use a base-4 structure for this system; it's modeled on our DNA. Well, my DNA, anyway." -Doctor Endo, Jinteki researcher
data.title: Encrypted Portals
data.text: All code gate ice have +1 strength. When you score Encrypted Portals, gain 1[credit] for each rezzed code gate.

data.flavor: Her eyes were the color of a vidscreen, tuned to a dead channel.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's identity text box is blank.
data.title: Cerebral Static
Targeted Marketing
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Name a card. Gain 10[credit] whenever the Runner plays or installs a copy of that card.

data.title: Information Overload
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Information Overload, <trace>trace 1</trace> if the trace is successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
Information Overload gains "[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards." for each tag the Runner has.
data.flavor: Throw enough data at a runner and it ceases to have any meaning at all.

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Gain 1[credit] whenever the Runner makes a successful run.
data.title: Paywall Implementation

data.flavor: Nothing is impenetrable. The key is to make breaking into it more costly than what it's worth.
data.title: Sealed Vault
data.text:
1[credit]: Move any number of credits from your credit pool to Sealed Vault.
[click] or [trash]: Move any number of credits from Sealed Vault to your credit pool.

Ignore the install cost of the first piece of ice you install each turn.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Eden Fragment

data.flavor: "I don't care how good your console is, or how tricked out your rig is. The lag time on a run on the moon from earthside can be a killer." -Leela Patel
data.text: This operation is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. All ice have +1 strength.
data.title: Lag Time

data.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, you may trash Will-o'-the-Wisp. If you do, choose an icebreaker that was used to break at least 1 subroutine during this run. The Runner adds that icebreaker to the bottom of his or her stack.
data.title: Will-o'-the-Wisp

data.text: Place 3 power counters on D4v1d when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a strength of 5 or greater.
data.title: D4v1d
data.flavor: Sometimes a single stone is enough.

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first piece of ice encountered each turn has -2 strength for the remainder of the run.
data.title: Scrubbed

data.flavor: In this business, you had to anticipate. If you weren't three steps ahead, you were three steps behind.
data.title: Three Steps Ahead
data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
When this turn ends, gain 2[credit] for each successful run you made during it.

data.flavor: What goes up must always go down.
data.title: Unscheduled Maintenance
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot install more than 1 piece of ice each turn.
Place 3 virus counters on Cache when it is installed. Hosted virus counter: Gain 1[credit].
data.title: Cache
data.flavor: "People keep saying that 'Cash is king' in the business, like it's untraceable in the days of DNA sniffers and microtracers. Digital credits can be just as anonymous, and they're just as easy to counterfeit." -Silhouette
Fifteen seconds of fame.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit during a run.
data.title: Net Celebrity

data.text: 3[credit] or [trash]: Prevent an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
data.title: LLDS Energy Regulator
data.flavor: Originally not very popular, the regulator was overlooked by those who used energy sinks to protect their rig. But it quickly found an audience once Smoke casted a run on a Blue Sun server, using it to keep her rig online while repeatedly diverting energy spikes in excess of 50,000 volts.

data.text:
Place 3[credit] on Ghost Runner when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Ghost Runner, trash it.
You can use the credits on Ghost Runner during a run.
data.title: Ghost Runner
data.flavor: In the spaces between the data, do trapped souls from the past persist?

Created by merging the brainscans of over a hundred of the most intelligent people in Haas-Bioroid's cerebral database, its effectiveness is limited beither by its lack of imagination or the imagination of the sysops who employ it.
data.title: IQ
data.text:
The rez cost of IQ is increased by 1 for each card in HQ.
IQ has +1 strength for each card in HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.
data.text: [click],[click],[click]: Rez a card, ignoring all costs.
data.title: Eliza's Toybox

data.text: [subroutine] The Corp may choose a card in HQ.  The Runner accesses that card.  If he or she does, trash Kitsune.
data.title: Kitsune
data.flavor: There are those who believe the nine-tailed fox is an angel in disguise.  And then there are those who have followed, and discovered her secret...
The port was first built as a remote location to unload and offload dangerous felons.
data.text: The Runner cannot jack out while running on this server unless he or she trashes 1 installed program. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Port Anson Grid

data.flavor: "There are reports of a terrorist threat at Starport Kaguya.  The NAPD is offering a reward for anyone who can provide them with information about the current whereabouts of the individual pictured here.  He is considered extremely dangerous and is armed with a PAD and a portable rig."
data.text: The Runner cannot play current events.
data.title: The News Now Hour
Manhunt
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner makes a successful run each turn, trace 2 if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

data.title: Wendigo
data.text: Wendigo can be advanced. While Wendigo has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains barrier and loses code gate. [subroutine] Choose a program. The Runner cannot use the chosen program for the remainder of this run.

data.flavor: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gargarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.
data.text: Successful runs against this server are not considered to be successful or unsuccessful for the purposes of card abilities. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Crisium Grid
Chronos Project
data.text: When you score Chronos Project, the Runner removes all cards in his or her heap from the game.
data.flavor: The irony is that those who'd want to destroy certain memories can't afford to do so, and those who can afford it-well, they're too busy sipping on dreamwine.

data.title: Shattered Remains
data.text:
Shattered Remains can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Shattered Remains, trash 1 piece of hardware for each advancement token on Shattered Remains.

When the Runner encounters Lancelot, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Lancelot gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] Trash 1 program.
data.title: Lancelot
data.flavor: He who wields the sword of valor.
"Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"
data.title: Quetzal: Free Spirit
data.text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.

data.title: BlacKat
data.text: 1[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine (or up to 3 subroutines if you spent a credit from a stealth card). 2[credit]: +1 strength (or +2 strength if you spent at least 1 credit from a stealth card).
data.flavor: Bad luck for any sysop blind enough to cross its path.

Carved directly out of the lunar rock, Duggar's is a popular spot among blue-collar loonies and slumming risties. A place where you could find what you're looking for-if you knew who to look for, and didn't get distracted by the energetic dancers.
data.text: [click],[click],[click],[click]: Draw 10 cards.
data.title: Duggar's
Box-E
data.text: +2[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 2. Limit 1 console per player.

data.flavor: "I can get you anything, and guarantee the best prices in town."
data.text:
[click]: Host a resource or piece of hardware from your grip on The Supplier.
When your turn begins, you may install a hosted card, lowering the install cost by 2.
data.title: The Supplier
Refractor
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +3 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
data.flavor: "If you look like you belong, people will ignore you for hours.  Or years.  It's only when you don't fit in that things start to go wrong." -Exile

data.text: The first time you have no credits in your credit pool each turn, gain 1[credit].
data.title: Order of Sol
data.flavor: There have been several attempts to create a "world church," uniting all human faiths into a single, harmonious whole.  The irony, of course, is that each new "world church" is another schism in humanity's shared religious experience.

data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may install Hades Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: Access all cards in Archives.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Hades Shard
Rachel Beckman
data.text:
You have 1 additional [click] to spend during your turn.
Trash Rachel Beckman if you are tagged.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
data.flavor:
"This is Rachel Beckman. She's in the business of keeping people alive."
Rachel smiled. "Only when I'm not in the business of killing them."

data.title: Architect
data.text:
Architect cannot be trashed while installed.
[subroutine] The Corp looks at the top 5 cards of R&D and may install 1 of those cards, ignoring all install costs.
[subroutine] The Corp may install a card from Archives or HQ (paying all costs).
data.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2012 World Champion Jeremy Zwirn</champion>

data.title: Peak Efficiency
data.text: Gain 1[credit] for each rezzed piece of ice.
data.flavor: "Servers fully-armed and operational."

data.title: Labyrinthine Servers
data.text: Place 2 power counters on Labyrinthine Servers when you score it. Hosted power counter: Prevent the Runner from jacking out. The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run.

data.flavor: The way past is to go a different way.
data.title: Ashigaru
data.text: Ashigaru gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each card in HQ.

Hosted power counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage. [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 power counter on Mamba.
data.title: Mamba

data.flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.
data.text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: The Runner loses 4[credit] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
data.title: Reversed Accounts

data.flavor: "It's a small one-time fee, apparently. Only I've paid it seventeen times."
data.title: Universal Connectivity Fee
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit] unless the Runner is tagged. If the Runner is tagged, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool and the Corp trashes Universal Connectivity Fee.

data.flavor: Unlimited Energy. Reasonable Prices.
data.title: Blue Sun: Powering the Future
data.text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 rezzed card to HQ and gain credits equal to its rez cost.

data.title: Changeling
data.text: Changeling can be advanced. While Changeling has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains sentry and loses barrier. [subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor: If the clones were nervous about living in a repurposed fuel tank, they never mentioned it.
data.title: Reuse
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Trash any number of cards from HQ. Gain 2[credit] for each card trashed.

When your turn begins, you may add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Hades Fragment
Docklands Crackdown
data.text:
[click], [click]: Place 1 power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
The install cost of the first card the Runner installs each turn is increased by 1 for each power counter on Docklands Crackdown.

data.title: Inject
data.text: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack and trash all programs revealed. Gain 1[credit] for each program trashed, and add the rest of the revealed cards to your grip.
data.flavor: "Knowledge comes in many different shapes and sizes." -Quetzal

The earliest instances of data folding were inspired by the traditional art of origami. Just as a crease pattern is the blueprint of a paper crane, there is a sequence to data that must be considered in order to achieve the greatest result.
data.title: Origami
data.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each copy of Origami installed.

data.flavor: "You should have known better than to scratch it…" -Quetzal
data.title: Fester
data.text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, he or she loses 2[credit], if able.

data.flavor: It practically runs itself, unless you're in a pinch.
data.title: Autoscripter
data.text:
The first time you install a program from your grip during your turn, gain [click].
Trash Autoscripter if you make an unsuccessful run.

data.flavor: Small. Compact. Easy to slip by monitoring programs and it can do some damage.
data.title: Switchblade
data.text: 1[credit]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card. 1[credit]: +7 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.

data.title: Trade-In
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed piece of hardware.
Gain credits equal to half the install cost of the trashed hardware (rounded down) and search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
+1[mu] Draw 1 card whenever the Corp creates a server. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Astrolabe
data.flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan

data.text: Place X power counters on Angel Arena when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Angel Arena, trash it. Hosted power counter: Reveal the top card of your stack. You may add that card to the bottom of your stack.
data.title: Angel Arena
data.flavor: "Low gravity sports are wildly popular, so match-fixing has proven wildly profitable." -Leela Patel

data.text: When you score Bifrost Array, you may trigger the "when scored" ability of another agenda that is not a copy of Bifrost Array in your score area.
data.title: Bifrost Array
data.flavor: "'What does it do?' Whatever I bloody want it to do." -Director Haas
Sagittarius promised foresight, but brought only regret.
data.text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 program. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 program.
data.title: Sagittarius

data.text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Hostile Infrastructure), do 1 net damage.
data.title: Hostile Infrastructure
